code: # simple sinkhorn example a <- c(.3, .4, .1, .1, .1) b <- c(.4, .5, .1) C <- rbind(   c(.1, .2, .3),   c(.2, .3, .4),   c(.4, .3, .2),   c(.3, .2, .1),   c(.5, .5, .4) ) reg <- .1 sol <- sinkhorn(a, b, C, sinkhorn_control = list(reg = reg, verbose = 0))  # you can also supply arguments to control the computation # for example, calculate the gradient w.r.t. a sol <- sinkhorn(a, b, C, sinkhorn_control = list(reg = reg, with_grad = TRUE, verbose = 0))
